makeKeyPair

                                                int keyLength)
                                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Generates a new key pair.

Parameters:
algorithm - the algorithm that should be used.
keyLength - the amount of bits that should be used. (A multiple of 64)
Returns:
a KeyPair that consists of a private and a corresponding public key
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no implementation for this algorithm is found

signData

public static void signData(java.security.PrivateKey pk)
A method for signing a file. This was only written for testing purposes and signs a file called test.

createCert

public static java.security.cert.X509Certificate createCert(java.security.PublicKey pubKey,
                                                            java.security.PrivateKey caPrivKey)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a certificate that contains a credential. The credential is stored in its String representation into the SubjectAlternativeName in a field called OtherName. This method uses the Bouncy Castle security provider that has to be added first (via the installBouncyCastle) method.

Parameters:
pubKey - the public key of the subject of the credential. This is needed to create a valid X509Certificate and might be usefull to improve security, when a public key infrastructure is used in this prototype environment.
caPrivKey - the key that is used to sign the credential
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createCert

public static java.security.cert.X509Certificate createCert(java.lang.String subject,
                                                            java.lang.String credential,
                                                            java.security.PublicKey pubKey,
                                                            java.lang.String issuer,
                                                            java.security.PrivateKey caPrivKey)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Generate a Certificate that holds a Credential as a critical Extension in it.

Parameters:
pubKey - the public key of the subject of the credential. This is needed to create a valid X509Certificate and might be usefull to improve security, when a public key infrastructure is used in this prototype environment.
subject - the distinguished name of the subject of this credential. Important: There exists a certain format for distinguished names. For example "CN=alice" is a valid DN.
credential - the String Representation of the credential
issuer - the name of the signer of the credential. This should be the person the caPrivKey belongs to.
caPrivKey - the key that is used to sign the credential
Returns:
A X.509Certificate
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
